intro: Atherurus, commonly known as the snowbell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Himalayas. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The leaves are typically compound, with a delicate, fern-like appearance. Atherurus species are often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments.
